body_html:
Hi @IssamLaradji,

This is because the is_same_size function requires both tensors to be of the same type. This was removed and input.nelement() == target.nelement() was used instead. You can probably solve this by upgrading to a newer version of pytorch/building from master
body_text:
Hi @IssamLaradji,
This is because the is_same_size function requires both tensors to be of the same type. This was removed and input.nelement() == target.nelement() was used instead. You can probably solve this by upgrading to a newer version of pytorch/building from master
body:
Hi @IssamLaradji, 

This is because the `is_same_size` function requires both tensors to be of the same type. This was removed and `input.nelement() == target.nelement()` was used instead. You can probably solve this by upgrading to a newer version of pytorch/building from master
